sen.j: 杖罪（じょうざい）、もしくは杖刑（じょうけい）とは、律令法の五刑の一つ。
sen.e: Flogging (jozai,杖罪 or jokei,杖刑) was one of the five sentences of the Ritsuryo law.

sen.j: 笞刑に次ぐ軽い刑罰である。
sen.e: It is a light punishment following whipping.
It is a lightest punishment except whipping.
It is a lightest punishment except whipping.

sen.j: 木製の杖をもって背中又は臀部を打つ刑である。
sen.e: It's a punishment, where the back or the buttocks were hitten with a wooden cane.
It's a punishment to hit the back or the buttocks with a wooden cane.
It's a punishment to hit the back or the buttocks with a wooden cane.

sen.j: 日本の大宝律令・養老律令では、単に「杖」と記されている。
sen.e: In the Taiyo Ritsuryo Code and the Yoro Ritsuryo Code it is merely recorded as "cane".
In the Taiyo Ritsuryo Code and the Yoro Ritsuryo Code it was merely recorded as "cane".

sen.j: 笞杖の太さ手元で4分（約12ミリメートル）、先端は3分（約9ミリ）、長さは3尺5寸（約1メートル5センチメートル）と定められ、受刑者の皮膚を破らないように節目などの凹凸は削られたものが使用された。
sen.e: The size of the cane was specified to be about 12mm thick at the handle, about 9mm at the tip and a length of about 1,05m. In order not to break the skin of the punished person a cane, where irregularities were shaved off, was used.

The size of the cane was specified to be about 12mm thick at the handle, about 9mm at the tip and a length of about 1,05m, and in order not to break the skin of the punished person, knags of the cane were sahved off.

This cane is called jokojo (常行杖).
This cane was called jokojo.

sen.j: なお、同様の杖が拷問用に使われる場合もあり、これを訊杖と呼んだ。
sen.e: The same cane is used for torture, but then it is called jinjo (訊杖).
Similar canes were used for torture, but then they were called jinjo.

sen.j: 杖罪を受けるものはあらかじめ刑具をつけずに獄に拘禁された。
sen.e: Felons who were flogged got interned in prison without getting another punishment.
Convicts who were to be flogged were imprisoned without apparatuses.
Convicts who were to be flogged were imprisoned without apparatuses.

sen.j: また、規定の常行杖に違反した場合や受刑者に対して重傷を負わせたり死に至らしめた場合には執行者が処罰される事もあった。
sen.e: If the cane was different than the specified jokojo, or if the felon was fatally injured, the executor got punished.
If the executor used a cane that is not compliant with the specified jokojo, or if the convict was severely or fatally injured, he may have been punished.
If the executor used a cane that is not compliant with the specified jokojo, or if the convict was severely or fatally injured, he could be subject to punishment.
sen.cmt: may have been punished -> could be subject to punishment

sen.j: 回数は罪の重さによって60回から100回までの5段階に分かれていた。
sen.e: The number of strokes depended on the seriousness of the crime, starting at 60 strokes and leading up in 5 steps to 100 strokes.
The number of strokes depended on the seriousness of the crime, from 60 strokes to 100 strokes in 5 steps.
sen.cmt: starting at 60 strokes and leading up in 5 steps to 100 strokes→from 60 strokes to 100 strokes in 5 steps.
sen.e: The number of strokes ranged from 60 strokes to 100 strokes in 5 steps, depending on the seriousness of the crime.
sen.cmt: depended →depending にして後ろに置きました。動詞rangeｄを追加しました。

sen.j: 笞は郡司による専断による処分が認められていたが、杖罪の決定権は国司が有し、必要によってはこれを専決する事が出来た。
sen.e: A district governor had the authority to impose the punishment of whipping, but only the province governor had the right to impose flogging depending on necessity he could decide it on his own.
A district manager had the authority to impose the punishment of whipping, but only the provincial governor had the right to decide flogging, in some cases, at his own discretion.

sen.j: また、在京諸司で罪が発覚した場合には杖刑以下は当該諸司の専決事項とした。
sen.e: If a crime was detected among the officials staying in Kyoto the appropriate official could decide a punishment lower than flogging on his own.
If a crime was detected among the officials staying in Kyoto, the appropriate official had an exclusive right to decide a punishment lower than flogging.

sen.j: また、帳内・資人が本主の命に反して罪した場合には本主個人が杖罪以下の執行することを許されていた。
sen.e: When a lower rank officer (chonai,shijin) acted against his master's orders, the master (honshu) was permitted to impose a punishment lower than flogging on his own.
When a lower rank officer (chonai, shijin) acted against his master's orders, the master (honshu) himself was permitted to execute a punishment lower than flogging on his own.

sen.j: 杖の回数と同じ斤量の銅を納めることで罪を回避すること（贖銅）も可能であった。
sen.e: It was also possible to avoid punishment by paying copper coins weighing the equivalent to the number of strokes of the cane. (shokudo,贖銅)
It was also possible to avoid punishment by paying copper coins weighing the equivalent to the number of strokes of the cane (shokudo, or atonement by copper).

sen.j: 中国の正史・『隋書』「」には、「」（その俗（中略）自餘は軽重をもって（中略）あるいは杖す）とあり俀國（倭国）において7世紀初頭には既に杖罪が存在していた事が記されており、その起源は少なくとも6世紀にまで遡れるようである。
sen.e: The beginning of flogging can at least be traced back to the 6th century, there is a record in China's official history Suisho (The Book of the Sui Dynasty) which says "in this world (…) otherwise depending on the gravity (…) they get flogged", which shows that this kind of punishment existed in Yamato (Japan) at the beginning of the 7th century.
